intro: Lamiodendron, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Americas, and thrives in warm, humid climates. Lamiodendron is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
